JEPATURA DE LA CAMPAÑA CONTRA LA FIEBRE
AMARILLA EN LA ZONA DE TAMPICO
Tampico, Tamps., Feb. 9 - 22
My dear Doctor Carter
div1.p:
Your of Feb. 6 - came today-
on Monday last I mailed to Consul
Marsh at Progresso your previous letter and
copy of alleged excerpt from the Tzium MSS

Mr. Marsh had previously written
me that he was attempting an article on y. f.
in Merida - with special reference to its pre-
Columbian presence there and as he is
in touch with all the students in Yucatan of
Maya history - we may expect something from
his search

“Cocolitzle”=from all that
I have learned to date the “Cocolitzle” were applied indiscrimately to epidemics of small-
pox, malaria and other epidemics, but I amwill
get in touch with some of the men in Mexico
at the museum and they may help us-
I hope to be able to this data for you soon-
but do not be disappointed if I am delayed,
as delays are the order of the day here now.
Our campaign goes steadily forward.
Caldwell writes that Pacific coast has
C1
B23
some cases - around Mozanmilla - we
are sending an Inspector there to work
with Dr. Haules, the Southern Pacific Medico
who is co-operating in the campaign.

In the areas around Papautla and
Tuxpan we are sweeping all the
towns and villages up to the mosquito
line - Fortunately in this zone there are
no large haciendas where the disease
could gain a foothold. Caldwell unquestion-
ably has or did have “hacienda foci,” in
his area - and the laborers from the
highlands kept the fire aburning- He
is sweeping the area now-

With continued good wishes and
kindest personal regards I am

closer.seg:
P. S. Don't hesitate to call on me to hunt data or anything
else, it will be a real joy to do it.
MEC
